docs.lead_paragraph: Visitors to the medical facility in one of Myanmar's poorest and most remote regions are greeted by a padlocked gate and a sign reading: "Clinic closed until further notice."

headline.main: Myanmar Muslims in Remote Rakhine Suffer Worsening Health Crisis
headline.print_headline: Myanmar Muslims in Remote Rakhine Suffer Worsening Health Crisis

docs.snippet: Visitors to the medical facility in one of Myanmar's poorest and most remote regions are greeted by a padlocked gate and a sign reading: "Clinic closed until further notice."

docs.lead_paragraph: Across the theological spectrum, clergy are urging Americans to welcome the child migrants arriving from Central America, and many are providing services for them.

headline.main: U.S. Religious Leaders Embrace Cause of Immigrant Children
headline.print_headline: U.S. Religious Leaders Embrace Cause of Children Streaming Across Border

docs.abstract: Religious leaders across United States are urging Americans to welcome the tens of thousands of migrant children arriving from Central America, and many are providing services for them; theological spectrum is wide, ranging from Unitarian Universalists and Quakers to evangelical Protestants and Jews; among most agitated are Catholic bishops and leaders of Southern Baptist Convention, who view anger directed toward vulnerable children as a moral crisis.
docs.snippet: Across the theological spectrum, clergy are urging Americans to welcome the child migrants arriving from Central America, and many are providing services for them.

byline.contributor: Ann Klein contributed reporting from Des Moines.

docs.lead_paragraph: This sauce is a tomato jam that tastes more like a richly spiced ketchup. A long simmer is important.
docs.snippet: This sauce is a tomato jam that tastes more like a richly spiced ketchup. A long simmer is important.

docs.lead_paragraph: San Francisco city leaders have approved a measure for the November ballot that would place a two-cents-per-ounce municipal tax on sodas and other sugary beverages, hoping to become the first major city to successfully impose such a levy.

headline.main: San Francisco Approves Soda Tax for November Ballot
headline.print_headline: San Francisco Approves Soda Tax for November Ballot

docs.snippet: San Francisco city leaders have approved a measure for the November ballot that would place a two-cents-per-ounce municipal tax on sodas and other sugary beverages, hoping to become the first major city to successfully impose such a levy.

headline.main: A Dietitian Who Won't Oversell Nutrition to Her Kids

docs.abstract: I learned long ago that nutrition information alone doesn’t motivate people to eat healthy, and I know telling my children that “broccoli will make them big and strong” could backfire.
docs.snippet: I learned long ago that nutrition information alone doesn’t motivate people to eat healthy, and I know telling my children that “broccoli will make them big and strong” could backfire.

docs.lead_paragraph: Billionaire investor William Ackman's latest volley of accusations against Herbalife Ltd on Tuesday missed its mark on Wall Street, with investors sending the stock price soaring 25 percent.

headline.main: Wall Street Rejects Ackman's Herbalife 'Death Blow'
headline.print_headline: Wall Street Rejects Ackman's Herbalife 'Death Blow'

docs.snippet: Billionaire investor William Ackman's latest volley of accusations against Herbalife Ltd on Tuesday missed its mark on Wall Street, with investors sending the stock price soaring 25 percent.

docs.lead_paragraph: Much as it has in 15-to-a-team rugby, New Zealand has dominated the shorter, faster version of the game.

docs.lead_paragraph: Sweet, juicy heirloom tomatoes can be made into a concassé that works as well with vegetables as it does with pasta or grains.

docs.lead_paragraph: San Francisco lawmakers narrowly agreed Tuesday to place a 2-cent-per-ounce tax on sugary drinks on the November ballot, a move that promises to turn the election into an expensive fight between the beverage industry and public health advocates.

headline.main: Board Puts Soda Tax Before San Francisco Voters
headline.print_headline: Board Puts Soda Tax Before San Francisco Voters

docs.snippet: San Francisco lawmakers narrowly agreed Tuesday to place a 2-cent-per-ounce tax on sugary drinks on the November ballot, a move that promises to turn the election into an expensive fight between the beverage industry and public health advocates.

docs.lead_paragraph: Activist investor Bill Ackman once again denounced weight loss and nutritional supplements company Herbalife as a pyramid scheme, but Wall Street shrugged off his criticism and sent the company's stock soaring 25 percent Tuesday.

headline.main: Ackman Goes After Herbalife's Nutrition Clubs
headline.print_headline: Ackman Goes After Herbalife's Nutrition Clubs

docs.snippet: Activist investor Bill Ackman once again denounced weight loss and nutritional supplements company Herbalife as a pyramid scheme, but Wall Street shrugged off his criticism and sent the company's stock soaring 25 percent Tuesday.
